: This article is about the biochemical compound. For the networking protocol,
: see [[User Datagram Protocol]].
'Uridine diphosphate', abbreviated 'UDP', is a nucleoside diphosphate. It is an
ester of pyrophosphoric acid with the nucleoside uridine. UDP consists of the
pyrophosphate group, the pentose sugar ribose, and the nucleobase uracil.
